Package InfrastructureManager.ModuleManagement

Class PlatformModule

java.lang.Object
InfrastructureManager.ModuleManagement.PlatformModule
All Implemented Interfaces:
ImmutablePlatformModule
Direct Known Subclasses:
AdvantEdgeModule, ConsoleModule, MatchMakingModule, NetworkModule, RemoteExecutionModule, RESTModule, ScenarioModule, UtilityModule
public abstract class PlatformModule
extends java.lang.Object
implements ImmutablePlatformModule
Abstract class to represent a platform module. Every concrete module implementation extends this class. Implements the ImmutablePlatformModule interface to provide a read-only facade. Modules are the main functional components of the system. A module is defined as a collection of predefined inputs and outputs which also has data about their connection either between each other or with other modules. The definition of different modules in the platforms configurator allows the system to be tailored in its functionalities to specific use cases. PlatformModules are containers of a sort for the different inputs and outputs (making them containers for the functionality) A module: - Has a state that influences its operation (IO in paused modules for example can't be used) - Keep track of inputs and the outputs to which they are connected (in this or other module) - Creates, configures and deploys Runnerobjects to read from the inputs and trigger the outputs - Acts as "middleman" between its objects, allowing for access to shared resources in a safe manner.

  • Field Details

    • runnerOperation

      protected RunnerOperation runnerOperation
      Default RunnerOperation which is passed to all created runners. In here, the input (the one related to each runner) is read for a command. This command is the processed according to the different connections of the input, and the processed response is sent to the appropriate output to trigger events. Exceptions happening in the process are redirected to be handled in the PlatformInput.response(ModuleExecutionException) method. Finally, throws ModuleStoppedException in a way that when the exception is raised the runner finished execution and the module can stop. For modules in which runners should perform different operations, this can be overridden.

      protected PlatformModule()
      Constructor of the class. Initialized the module with an INITIAL state.

    • setInputs

      protected void setInputs​(PlatformInput... inputs)
      Adds inputs to the module. It also configures the built-in ModuleDebugInput with a default name of "MODULE_NAME.debug"
      Parameters:
      inputs - PlatformInput objects, separated by commas

    • setOutputs

      protected void setOutputs​(PlatformOutput... outputs)
      Adds outputs to the module
      Parameters:
      outputs - PlatformOutput objects, separated by commas.

    • addConnection

      public void addConnection​(java.lang.String inputName, Connection connection) throws IncorrectInputException
      Add a connection to this module. This method, normally called by a ModuleConnector allows to add a connection to one of the inputs of this module based on its name
      Parameters:
      inputName - Name of the input to connect
      connection - Connection to add to the input (Includes output and commands)
      Throws:
      IncorrectInputException - If the input could not be found inside the module's inputs list

    • restartThread

      protected void restartThread​(int index, int runnerIndex)
      Allows to restart a dead thread. Useful for restarting Runners that have finished their operations
      Parameters:
      index - Index of the thread in the thread's list (A new thread will replace it)
      runnerIndex - Index of the runner in the runnerList. The new thread will run this runner

    • isDeadThread

      protected boolean isDeadThread​(int index)
      Allows to know if a thread is dead (Runner finished its execution)
      Parameters:
      index - Index of the thread in the inputRunnerThreads list
      Returns:
      true if the thread is dead, false otherwise

    • start

      public void start()
      Starts the module by creating and starting threads for the runners in each of the inputs

    • pause

      public void pause()
      Pauses the module. A paused module's inputs and outputs are also paused

    • resume

      public void resume()
      Resumes a paused module

    • stop

      public void stop()
      Stops a module and finishes all runners execution

    • hasInput

      protected boolean hasInput​(java.lang.String inputName)
      Check if the module has an input configured with the defined name
      Parameters:
      inputName - Name of the input to search
      Returns:
      true if the inputs is configured in the module, false otherwise

    • processCommand

      public java.lang.String processCommand​(java.lang.String fromInput, CommandSet commands) throws ResponseNotDefinedException
      Based on the commands defined as part of the connection between an input and an output, processes the input command and returns the command to send to the output.
      Parameters:
      fromInput - Reading from an input
      commands - Commands defined in the connection between input and output
      Returns:
      Response mapped for the passed input command
      Throws:
      ResponseNotDefinedException - If no response can be found in the given command set for the given input command

    • getRunnerFromInput

      protected Runner getRunnerFromInput​(java.lang.String inputName) throws IncorrectInputException
      Given an input, fetches the runner related to it.
      Parameters:
      inputName - Name of the input
      Returns:
      Runner that is related to the passed input
      Throws:
      IncorrectInputException - If the input could not be found inside the module's inputs list
